author: cResults
body:
we have a Azure DevOps build task that has a task with the following code:
```
	Write-Host PACKAGE_NAMING_FILE_PATH: $filePath
	$packageID = Split-Path $filePath -LeafBase
	Write-Host PackageID_Set_To_File_NAME: $packageID
```

While this code path doesn't get executed very often, it is my understanding that it previously worked.

Here is the error that we are now getting

```
2018-11-15T13:31:26.5116459Z PACKAGE_NAMING_FILE_PATH: D:\a\1\s\Nuget\Etrieve.ExceptionHandling\Etrieve.ExceptionHandling.csproj
2018-11-15T13:31:26.8937041Z Split-Path : A parameter cannot be found that matches parameter name 'LeafBase'.
2018-11-15T13:31:26.8938850Z At D:\a\1\s\.ancillary\Build\NugetCSProjVersion.ps1:34 char:43
2018-11-15T13:31:26.8938900Z +         $packageID = Split-Path $filePath -LeafBase
2018-11-15T13:31:26.8938942Z +                                                 ~~~~~~~~~
2018-11-15T13:31:26.8939003Z     + CategoryInfo          : InvalidArgument: (:) [Split-Path], ParentContainsErrorRecordException
2018-11-15T13:31:26.8939049Z     + FullyQualifiedErrorId : NamedParameterNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.SplitPathCommand
2018-11-15T13:31:26.8939084Z  
```

[this docs.microsoft.com post suggests that this code should work](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.management/split-path?view=powershell-6), please advise

poin #https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/issues/7840#issuecomment-439227178

comments.author: mklement0
comments.body:
Are you running _Windows PowerShell_? It is only PowerShell _Core_ that supports this parameter, as evidenced by its absence from the [WinPS v5.1 version of the docs](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/microsoft.powershell.management/split-path?view=powershell-5.1).

You can work around the problem as follows:

```powershell
[io.path]::GetFileNameWithoutExtension($filePath)
```

comments.author: cResults
comments.body: It is running in Azure DevOps environment. so what ever version of PowerShell that it uses.  I had just found the GetFileNameWithoutExtension workaround and it is working.  Thank you.

title: Split-Path : A parameter cannot be found that matches parameter name 'LeafBase'
